Module dunbar.c482pa
Package dunbar.c482pa.Model

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
dunbar.c482pa.Model.Inventory
public class Inventory extends javafx.application.Application
This class creates an inventory application that can be used to track parts and products. Holds the main method for the application. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: Adding the ability to create a history list for parts and products to track items no longer kept in inventory. Could be used to create an obsolete part database to reference if a customer wanted to buy a replacement that is no longer in inventory.

    • addPart

      public static void addPart(Part newPart)
      Adds a Part object to the allParts Observable List. Accepts a Part object and appends it to allParts.
      Parameters:
      newPart - Part to add

    • addProduct

      public static void addProduct(Product newProduct)
      Adds a product to the allProducts Observable list. Accepts a Product object and appends it to allProducts.
      Parameters:
      newProduct - Product to add

    • lookupPart

      public static Part lookupPart(int partID)
      Searches the allParts observable list for a specified part. Accepts a part ID value and searches the allParts list for a part with a matching ID.
      Parameters:
      partID - ID of the part to search for.
      Returns:
      Returns the desired part, or null if the part was not found

    • lookupProduct

      public static Product lookupProduct(int productID)
      Searches the allProducts observable list for a specified product. Accepts a product ID value and searches the allProducts list for a product with a matching ID.
      Parameters:
      productID - ID of the product to search for.
      Returns:
      Returns the desired Product, or null if the product was not found

    • lookupPart

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookupPart(String partName)
      Searches the allParts observable list for a specified part. Accepts a string and searches the allParts list for a part with a name that contains the input string.
      Parameters:
      partName - string to search for
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all parts whose name contains the input string. If no parts contain the input string, returns an empty list.

    • lookupProduct

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> lookupProduct(String productName)
      Searches the allProducts observable list for a specified product. Accepts a string and searches the allParts list for a part with a name that contains the input string.
      Parameters:
      productName - string to search for
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all products whose name contains the input string. If no parts contain the input string, returns an empty list.

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart(int index, Part selectedPart)
      Replaces a part in the allParts list with another part. Accepts an index value and a Part object, and places the Part at the desired index location, overwriting any existing part at that index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the part to be replaced
      selectedPart - the part that is replacing the current part in the list

    • updateProduct

      index - the index of the product to be replaced
      newProduct - the product that is replacing the current product in the list

    • deletePart

      public static boolean deletePart(Part selectedPart)
      Removes a part from the allParts list.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - Part to be removed
      Returns:
      Returns true if the part was found and removed, otherwise returns false

    • getFilteredParts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getFilteredParts()
      Retrieves the filteredParts list. This list consists of parts currently meeting the criteria of the part search field.
      Returns:
      Returns the Observable List filteredParts

    • getFilteredProducts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> getFilteredProducts()
      Retrieves the filteredProducts list. This list consists of products currently meeting the criteria of the product search field.
      Returns:
      Returns the Observable List filteredProducts

      Brings up the main window of the application. Implements the start method of the Application interface to launch the main window of the application when launch() is called in main(). Applies the scene defined in MainWindow.fxml to the stage.
